com.appdynamics.instrumentation.sdk.template.async

Class AAsyncExitStart

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.appdynamics.instrumentation.sdk.ASDKPlugin
      • com.appdynamics.instrumentation.sdk.AOutOfProcessCorrelator
        • com.appdynamics.instrumentation.sdk.template.async.AAsyncExitStart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRuleAppliable

    public abstract class AAsyncExitStart
extends AOutOfProcessCorrelator
    Extend this object to enable tracking of an async exit point. This plugin should be placed on a method that marks the beginning of an async exit point, and the method should have access to an object that can be used to inject the correlation header as well as an object that is common between this method and a method that ends the transaction marked by AAsyncExitEnd If the method exits with an exception, then we will track the method as a synchronous exit point and the getAsyncObject(Object, Object[], Object) might still be called but not used to match with AAsyncExitEnd (unless getAsyncObjectOnExeption() is true). The exit call will be marked as Error in snapshots Warning: this plugin must be used with an AAsyncExitEnd plugin to properly begin and end an async transaction. Without an AAsyncExitEnd plugin it could create a memory leak with catastrophic consequences. created by haojun.li on 6/28/18

      • marshalTransactionContext

        public abstract void marshalTransactionContext(java.lang.String correlationHeader,
                                               java.lang.Object invokedObject,
                                               java.lang.String className,
                                               java.lang.String methodName,
                                               java.lang.Object[] paramValues,
                                               java.lang.Throwable thrownException,
                                               java.lang.Object returnValue,
                                               ISDKUserContext context)
                                        throws ReflectorException
        Marshals the transaction context into payload, which can be accessed via reflection on the various arguments
        Parameters:
        correlationHeader - The transaction context that should be stashed in the payload
        invokedObject - The object the method was invoked on. null for static methods. available at begin/end.
        className - The name of the class this method was called on. available at begin/end.
        methodName - The name of the method invoked. available at begin/end.
        paramValues - An array of the parameters passed to the method. available at begin/end.
        thrownException - The exception thrown by this invocation of the method. null if method exits normally. available ONLY on end.
        returnValue - The return value of the method. null if exception was thrown. available ONLY on end.
        context - The ISDKUserContext that can be used to pass objects between sdk methods.
        Throws:
        ReflectorException - if this method throws any kind of exception, then the correlation header cannot be assumed to be injected

      • identifyBackend

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> identifyBackend(java.lang.Object invokedObject,
                                                                                 java.lang.String className,
                                                                                 java.lang.String methodName,
                                                                                 java.lang.Object[] paramValues,
                                                                                 java.lang.Throwable thrownException,
                                                                                 java.lang.Object returnValue,
                                                                                 ISDKUserContext context)
                                                                          throws ReflectorException
        Given the current snapshot of invocation state, produces a map of identifying properties used to identify the backend
        Parameters:
        invokedObject - The object the method was invoked on. null for static methods. available at begin/end.
        className - The name of the class this method was called on. available at begin/end.
        methodName - The name of the method invoked. available at begin/end.
        paramValues - An array of the parameters passed to the method. available at begin/end.
        thrownException - The exception thrown by this invocation of the method. null if method exits normally. available ONLY on end.
        returnValue - The return value of the method. null if exception was thrown. available ONLY on end.
        context - The ISDKUserContext that can be used to pass objects between sdk methods.
        Returns:
        the identifying property set
        Throws:
        ReflectorException

      • getAsyncObject

        public abstract java.lang.Object getAsyncObject(java.lang.Object invokedObject,
                                                java.lang.Object[] paramValues,
                                                java.lang.Object returnValue)
        Gets the Object we will use to match this async exit start to an async exit end. This object must match the object used in AAsyncExitEnd.getAsyncObject(Object, Object[], Object) for the async exit to work correctly. If this method returns null then we will not track this exit call as an async exit call. We will use the Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() to determine equality instead of whether they point to the same object
        Parameters:
        invokedObject - the object the method was invoked in. null for static methods.
        paramValues - An array of the parameters passed to the method.
        returnValue - the return value of the function call ONLY IF getAsyncObjectOnEnd() is true, null otherwise
        Returns:
        an object we will use to match with AAsyncExitEnd.getAsyncObject(Object, Object[], Object) to properly end a transaction

      • resolveToNode

        public boolean resolveToNode()
        Tells the agent whether or not to resolve this exit to a node if correlation is set up between this exit and a downstream entry. If this returns true, the exit will be represented as an edge directly from the upstream to downstream tier. If this returns false, the exit will be represented as an edge to an intermediate backend in the flow map (i.e. a queue) and another edge from that backend to the downstream tier.
        Returns:
        true or false, depending on desired behavior described above

      • identifyOnEnd

        public boolean identifyOnEnd()
        Tells the agent if it should identify the backend when the method ends. If this is false, it will identify at the beginning. This must be true if getAsyncObjectOnEnd() is true
        Returns:
        false if identifying should be done on end, true otherwise

      • getAsyncObjectOnEnd

        public boolean getAsyncObjectOnEnd()
        Tells the agent if it should get the async object at the end of the method. It is possible that some of the paramValues are not fully populated on method begin.
        Returns:
        true if we need to call the getAsyncObject(Object, Object[], Object) on then end of the method, false otherwise.

      • getAsyncObjectOnExeption

        public boolean getAsyncObjectOnExeption()
        Tells the agent if it should get the async object even if an exception occurred during the execution of the method instrumented. If this is true and the corresponding AAsyncExitEnd is never called then it could create a massive memory leak. Override with caution.
        Returns:
        true if the agent should still get the async object and attempt to track this exit call as async exit call

      • addSnapshotData

        public void addSnapshotData(java.lang.Object invokedObject,
                            java.lang.String className,
                            java.lang.String methodName,
                            java.lang.Object[] paramValues,
                            java.lang.Throwable thrownException,
                            java.lang.Object returnValue,
                            ISDKUserContext context,
                            ISDKDataContext dataContext)
                     throws ReflectorException
        This method attempt to add more information as properties into the snapshot. All data should be added into the dataContext object using ISDKDataContext.storeData(String, Object). Information that was stored inside the UserContext (from other SDK calls) can also be access here and put into the DataContext for display in an snapshot.
        Parameters:
        invokedObject - The object the method was invoked on. null for static methods. available at begin/end.
        className - The name of the class this method was called on. available at begin/end.
        methodName - The name of the method invoked. available at begin/end.
        paramValues - An array of the parameters passed to the method. available at begin/end.
        thrownException - The exception thrown by this invocation of the method. null if method exits normally. available ONLY on end.
        returnValue - The return value of the method. null if exception was thrown. available ONLY on end.
        context - The ISDKUserContext that can be used to pass objects between sdk methods.
        dataContext - The map the agent will use to put information into a snapshot. All information is put into the snapshot as a list of key value pair
        Throws:
        ReflectorException - any exceptions will be handled by the agent in logs
